alert.note: Alert for Crowley; Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 8:21PM MDT until July 06 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN CROWLEY AND CENTRAL OTERO COUNTIES... At 821 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing extemely heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The heaviest rain is falling on highway 50 between Manzanola and Rocky Ford. Potentially dangerous flash flooding is likely occurring in this area along highway 50. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... La Junta, North La Junta, Rocky Ford, Fowler, Ordway, Swink, Manzanola, Olney Springs, Sugar City, Cheraw and Crowley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
